titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Congresswoman Lynn Schenk papers LSC.2209

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 24 February 2017.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-01-28 13:38:31 -0800.

did.abstract: Lynn Schenk is a lawyer and politician who served one term in the U.S. House of Representatives as a congresswoman from San Diego. She also served as Chief of Staff to Gray Davis during his entire tenure as Governor of California. The collection consists mostly of material from these offices, including subject files, correspondence, and administrative records. There is also material relating to several political campaigns, including Schenk's own, the 2003 gubernatorial recall, and the 2004 presidential race.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Congresswoman Lynn Schenk Papers (Collection 2209). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Lynn Schenk was born on January 5, 1945 in the Bronx, New York. The daughter of immigrants from Eastern Europe, she and her family moved westward, finally settling in Los Angeles. Schenk received a BA from UCLA, and then earned her law degree at the University of San Diego. Politically and socially active, in 1972 she co-founded the Lawyers Club of San Diego as an organization to support female lawyers and to advocate for women's rights in general. In 1975, she was appointed a White House Fellow and worked for three years in the Office of the Vice President. In 1992, she ran for the U.S. Congress in a newly created district that encompassed most of San Diego. When she won, she became the first woman ever elected to the House of Representatives from the city, and the first Democrat in forty years. Though she lost her reelection bid in 1994, she remained active in Democratic and California politics. In 1998, governor-elect Gray Davis asked her to serve as his Chief of Staff, and she remained in that role until Davis was recalled in 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material relating to the political career of Lynn Schenk, especially her term as a member of the U.S. House of Representatives and her position as Chief of Staff to California governor Gray Davis. There are subject files with information about issues important to voters, as well as administrative files regarding the operations of various offices. There is correspondence from constituents, lobbyists, and other political figures. The collection also contains a great deal of material on campaigns, including the successful effort to recall Davis from office, and the 2004 presidential race, during which Schenk was an important fundraiser for John Kerry. Also represented are Schenk's unsuccessful bids for the San Diego County Board of Supervisors and California attorney general. There is also a small amount of personal material.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection is organized into the following series:
Series 1. Chief of Staff files
Series 2. U.S. Congress files
Series 3. White House Fellows files
Series 4. California Attorney General files
Series 5. San Diego County Board of Supervisors files
Series 6. Kerry/Edwards campaign files
Series 7. Personal files

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Political Cartoons and Caricatures from the Collection of Michael Alexander Kahn (New York: The Grolier Club, 2007).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material from Schenk's tenure as Chief of Staff to California governor Gray Davis.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are maintained in their original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes material relating to a variety of topics, both political and administrative.

did.unittitle: Phil Trounstine speech [to the Democratic Leadership Council]
Macarro, Mark [Pechanga Band of Luiseno Indians]
San Diego traffic congestion relief plan
Legal Aid Society of San Diego
Democratic governors and Chiefs of Staff
San Diego Dialogue's McGill Circle breakfast
SBC Pacific Bell - new regulatory framework
Issues: Civil Rights / Consumers / Education / Environment
Issues: Gay/Lesbian / Good Government / Health Care / Housing
Issues: Human Services / Innovative Government / Labor / Latino/a
Issues: Local Government / Major Cities and Regions / Native Americans / Public Safety
Governor Gray Davis [booklet touting his accomplishments]
California Statewide Survey for Governor Gray Davis [polling data]
Environmental Impact Statement for the Completion of the 14-Mile Border Infrastructure System, San Diego, California
Resumes and bios [of Schenk and her husband, Hugh Friedman]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains proof sheets from events opposing Davis's recall; participants include Warren Beatty, Annette Bening, Jack Nicholson, Bruce Wilis, Jesse Jackson.

did.unittitle: California Council on Science and Technology
Price Movements in California Exchange Markets
Transition 2003: California State Agencies, Departments, Boards and Commissions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of a letter from Gray Davis to Arnold Schwarzenegger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Incoming correspondence (which is usually accompanied by a response) is organized by month from December, 1998 to November, 2001, although January-March, 1999 is missing. After that, the correspondence is only minimally present, and unsorted. Outgoing correspondence (which consists only of copies of Schenk's replies, which are often handwritten) is well-sorted for 2000 and roughly chronological for 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Two pins in the shape of California designed for Gray and Sharon Davis by the Franklin Mint.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SUBSERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this subseries will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: FILE CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this file will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material regarding Schenk's term in the U.S. House of Representatives, and the election campaigns associated with it.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are maintained in their original order.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are maintained in original order.

did.unittitle: Dept. of Commerce Grant - San Diego World Trade Center
The Economy under President Clinton: the First Twenty Months
Manual on the Federal Budget Process

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material related to Schenk's time as a White House Fellow, working in the office of the Vice President of the United States under both Nelson Rockefeller and Walter Mondale. The material primarily concerns staff and office procedures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material relating to Schenk's campaign for California Attorney General.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are maintained in original order.

did.unittitle: Series 5. San Diego County Board of Supervisors files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of material relating to Schenk's campaign to join the San Diego County Board of Supervisors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material on the 2004 U.S. presidential election, during which Schenk was a very active trustee for the John Kerry campaign. It consists mostly of documents related to a variety of fundraising events across the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material not connected to a specific job or campaign.
